feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student demonstrates a working financial application: it ingests unstructured goals, produces structured savings scenarios/recommendations, outputs to Excel, and the student validated the numeric results matched manual calculations. The DRIVER stages (Discover → Implement → Reflect) show deliberate development and verification, meeting the PASS standard.
- Integrate AI: The student shows a clear, working AI integration: the AI converts unstructured user language into structured financial outputs, is embedded in NA10 with Excel export, and was validated by manual recalculation. Iterative DRIVER stages (Discover → Implement → Reflect) demonstrate deliberate engineering to make the AI reliable, satisfying the criterion for effective AI integration.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "For the mic project three, what I did was to build an AI finance tool using NA10 that it could completely take unstructured financial goals and basically turn them into structured savings analysis with scenarios, recommendations and clean data logging."
"What I did for my second loop was to rebuild the whole thing inside NA10... I inputed a chat message into the chatbot."

"I manually recalculated the conservative the balance and the aggressive scenar. scenarios using the same formulas and it gave me the exact same values. They matched exactly and this obviously mattered because this proved that the tool wasn't just like giving random things. It actually followed the math and it worked."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — identified the user problem (messy conversational inputs). Implement — rebuilt the system in NA10, created strict system message, ran chat inputs and produced Excel outputs. Reflect — verified results and iterated on design, recognizing the importance of the engineered environment.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates a working financial application: it ingests unstructured goals, produces structured savings scenarios/recommendations, outputs to Excel, and the student validated the numeric results matched manual calculations. The DRIVER stages (Discover → Implement → Reflect) show deliberate development and verification, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "build an AI finance tool using NA10 that it could completely take unstructured financial goals and basically turn them into structured savings analysis with scenarios, recommendations and clean data logging."
"for my second loop was to rebuild the whole thing inside NA10."

"I manually recalculated the conservative the balance and the aggressive scenar. scenarios using the same formulas and it gave me the exact same values. They matched exactly and this obviously mattered because this proved that the tool wasn't just like giving random things. It actually followed the math and it worked."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — identified the need to handle messy conversational inputs; Implement — rebuilt workflow in NA10, created a strict system message, fed chat input to the AI and produced Excel outputs; Reflect — validated outputs, iterated on prompts/structure and engineered the environment around the AI.
criteria.reasoning: The student shows a clear, working AI integration: the AI converts unstructured user language into structured financial outputs, is embedded in NA10 with Excel export, and was validated by manual recalculation. Iterative DRIVER stages (Discover → Implement → Reflect) demonstrate deliberate engineering to make the AI reliable, satisfying the criterion for effective AI integration.
